item.description:
@delta wrote:

Like that lol

public void forums() {
client noob = (client)p;
if(noob.getsNoHelp){
noob.attemptsToGiveFakeRewards += 1;
noob.sendMessage(“Max attemptsToGiveFakeRewards experience reached”);
}

item.title: An altar, gives u RC xp & All magic runes
item.dc:creator: @For For ( ; ; )
item.description:
@For wrote:

You have to declare the variable p.

You don’t need == true on this part.

if(noob.getsnohelp == true){

You need to use proper java conventions.

if(noob.getsNoHelp) { noob.attemptsToGiveFakeRewards = true;

item.title: An altar, gives u RC xp & All magic runes
item.dc:creator: @For For ( ; ; )
item.description:
@For wrote:

[quote=“delta, post:2, topic:168903”]You cannot give rewards. Also look at my old void i made

public void forums() {
client noob = (client)p;
if(noob.getsnohelp == true){
noob.attemptstogivefakerewards = true;
noob.addSkillXP(25, 1);
noob.sendMessage(“Max experience reached”);
}
}[/quote]

It’s called a method not a void. Also you have programming mistakes.

Read full topic
